newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian rubber continues to fall at close.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian rubber continues to fall at close.

text.p: Further falls in the Tokyo market coupled with slow consumer demand dragged down prices at the close, dealers said.
"Sentiment continues easier in the rubber market," a dealer said, adding that buyers again waited for cheaper levels in view of uncertainty in overseas markets.
There was scattered interest from Far East buyers, but they were just checking on price, dealers said.
Dealers offered SMR CV at 318 cents, SMR L at 299, SMR 5 at 269, SMR 10 at 249, SMR 20 at 248 and latex at 215.
At the close, July RSS1 buyer eased two cents to 270 cents ($1.07) a kg and July SMR 20 buyer was down 1.50 cents at 249.50 cents.

Latex demand is also slackening with the approaching summer holidays sidelining most players. "The market is going to be slow. Buyers continue to wait for cheaper and cheaper prices due to the falling market in Tokyo," another dealer said.
The INRO five-day average was 204.51 Malaysian/Singapore cents a kg on June 24 from 205.93 on June 23. The daily indicator was 202.06 against 203.80.
